message:
{
    "name": "Kottler (Schwarzschild-de Sitter) metric",
    "abbrev": "kottlerSchwarzschildDeSitter",
    "description": "The Kottler metric is a spacetime metric that combines the Schwarzschild metric for a black hole with the de Sitter metric for an expanding universe. It represents a black hole in an expanding universe.",
    "defined": true,
    "derived": false,
    "signature": -1,
    "dimensions": 4,
    "charts": [
        {
            "chartName": "Spherical",
            "xlineElement": "-(
        1 - (2*Ms/(r*Rs)) - (Rs^3/(r^3))
    )dt^2 + (
        1 - (2*Ms/(r*Rs)) - (Rs^3/(r^3))
    )dr^2 + (
        r^2
    )*(dθ^2 + (sin(θ)^2)*dφ^2)",
            "validated": false,
        }
    ],
    "desiredProperties": [
        "christoffels",
        "ricci",
        "riemann",
        "einstein",
        "weyl",
        "g00",
        "infiniteRedShift",
        "horizons",
        "singularities",
        "limits"
    ],
    "diagrams": []
}[0m
